title: Staining Sequenza

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

request.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

source.description:
Fill a disposable Pipetting Reservoir with
of 1x PBS wash buffer
Place sample slide on a Sequenza cover plate aligning the bottom slide with the notches on the cover plate (see picture below panel A)

Fill by capillarity the space between the slide and cover plate by holding the parts tight and dipping the bottom part of
the assembly in the wash buffer reservoir (see picture above panel B)
Transfer the slide and coverplate assembly into the Sequenza rack. Slip in the assembly (see below picture panel C)
Secure the assembly and make sure that the assembly placed down in the rack (see above picture panel D)

Add
of Blocking buffer)
Place the cover and incubate with the blocking buffer for 1h

Add
of wash buffer. The buffer should flow thru within 1 min 30 s. Repeat by adding 1 mL of wash buffer

If you are using biotinylated antibody or probe, you need to block endogenous biotin
Add 3 drops of Avidin solution sufficient to cover the sample and incubate for
Add 1 mL of wash buffer
Add drops Biotin solution sufficient to cover the sample and incubate for

Add
of wash buffer
Next day, use anti-biotin metal-labeled antibody (1D4-C5) in Stain 2 panel

If presence of bubbles are observed after adding Avidin and Biotin solution.
Dismount the slide and the Sequenza cover plate

Fill by capillarity the space between the slide and cover plate by holding the parts tight and dipping the bottom part of
the assembly in the wash buffer reservoir (see picture above panel B)

Spin down briefly all antibody tubes at
for
, preferably at
Pipet the respective amount of each individual antibody. Do not disturb the bottom of the antibody tube when pipetting
The total volume needed for staining each Sequenza slide assembly is

source.body: The manufacturer recommend to use 100 µL per Sequenza slide assembly. 120 µL is therefore a 20% excess.

source.description: Prepare 0.1 µm filter unit

Prepare a panel table in excel including the following information:
Conjugation ID, Target name, Channel, , Antibody concentration, Titer, Volume
Exemple:
ABCDEF
1IDTarget nameChannelConcentration (ug/mL)Titer (ug/mL)Calculation formulation for Volume (µL)
21299CD4143501=$F$6*E2/D2
31221CD11c161500.25=$F$6*E3/D3
41292CD3159500.5=$F$6*E4/D4
5..................
6Total volume (µL)150
7Antibody diluent volume=F6-SUM(F2,F3,F4)
8Antibody mix volume=F6-F7

ABCDEF
1IDTarget nameChannelConcentration (ug/mL)Titer (ug/mL)Calculation formulation for Volume (µL)
21299CD4143501=$F$6*E2/D2
31221CD11c161500.25=$F$6*E3/D3
41292CD3159500.5=$F$6*E4/D4
5..................
6Total volume (µL)150
7Antibody diluent volume=F6-SUM(F2,F3,F4)
8Antibody mix volume=F6-F7
Add first, antibody diluent (NHS 3%) to complete to the total volume
Add 400 µL of antibody diluent buffer (NHS 3%) to a 0.1 µm centrifugal filter device
Spin at 10,000 x g for 1 min
Discard the flowthough by aspirating
Add the antibody mix to the filter unit
Spin at 10,000 x g for 1 min

After, blocking incubation, add
of antibody buffer (NHS 3%)
Make sure that the antibody buffer has passed through to prevent dilution of antibody mix. Note: this should take no more than 2 min
Add antibody master mix,

source.body: The manufacturer recommend to use 100 µL per Sequenza slide assembly. 120 µL is therefore a 20% excess.

source.description: Place back the rack cover, transfer to 4˚C refrigerator, and incubate overnight

Prepare 1 hr antibody master mix as described above in steps 15 to 18
Optional: include use anti-biotin or other anti-hapten antibodies when apply
Following overnight incubation, wash with 1 mL of wash buffer
Repeat wash by 1 mL of wash buffer
Add 300 µL antibody buffer (NHS 3%)
Make sure that the antibody buffer has passed thru to prevent dilution of the antibody mix
Add Stain 2 antibody mix and incubate for 1 hour at 4˚C

The slide preparation is the same as described in the protocol MIBI staining
dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bh9zj976
Add 1 mL of wash buffer
Repeat step 29
Remove the slide for the assembly
Immerse the slide in post-fixation buffer (glutaraldehyde 4% in PBS-low Barium) for 5 min
Transfer in PBS-low Barium for rinse, <2 min

Rearrange and fill additional reagent containers:
Tris buffer pH 8.5 x 3, ddH2O x 2, 70% EtOH, 80% EtOH, 95% EtOH x 2, 100% EtOH x 2, exit tank = empty and dry
Insert slides into slide carriers. Place slide carriers into placeholder containers into the first Tris buffer container
Menu --> Processing time = 30 sec, Lift bar = 976, Number of dips = 3, Start position = position of the first slide carrier
Press Run
Dry in vacuum desiccator with the slide carrier lid open for at least 1 hour prior to MIBI analysis

description: This protocol describes the use of sequenza staining device. The sequenza can be use for MIBI or IHC staining methods.
